sentences.sContent: Derrida famously, notoriously, said "there is nothing outside the text," right? What he meant by that, of course, is that there's nothing but text.
sentences.sContent_eng: Derrida famously, notoriously, said "there is nothing outside the text," right? What he meant by that, of course, is that there's nothing but text.
sentences.sCn: 德里达著名地，恶名昭彰地，说道，文本之外什么都没有“,是吧，当然，他意思就是说，需要考虑的只有文本。

sentences.sContent: ...Political sentiment is notoriously changeable: What if things begin to go wrong for Obama...

synos.tran: 众所周知地；声名狼藉地；恶名昭彰地

words.tran: 声名狼藉的，臭名昭著的
